alert.note: Alert for Southern Fairfield; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued March 02 at 6:25PM EST until March 04 at 11:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...1 1/2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level possible in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Southern Fairfield and Southern New Haven Counties. In New York, Southern Westchester, Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Widespread minor to scattered moderate flooding of vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 feet of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. This will result in numerous road closures and cause widespread flooding of low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. Flooding will also extend inland from the waterfront along tidal rivers and bays. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 4 ft along open east and northeast facing shorelines will result in beach erosion, with wave splashover over dunes and bulkheads exacerbating flooding of shoreline roads and properties. Localized minor damage to shoreline structures is possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The magnitude of coastal flooding will be heavily determined by the timing of winds shifting from the east to the northeast in relation to the time of high tide Saturday morning. At this point, this windshift is expected to occur right around the time of high tide. An earlier windshift would result in water levels falling to the low end of the forecast range, while a later windshift would result in water levels rising to on the high end of the forecast range. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. STAMFORD HARBOR AT STAMFORD CT MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 9.4 FT, MODERATE 11.0 FT, MAJOR 12.4 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.6 FT, MODERATE 3.2 FT, MAJOR 4.6 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 02/08 PM 6.6/ 7.1 -1.3/-0.8 0.7/ 1.1 1 NONE 03/09 AM 7.8/ 8.3 0.0/ 0.5 1.1/ 1.6 0-1 NONE 03/09 PM 8.0/ 8.5 0.2/ 0.7 1.8/ 2.2 1-2 NONE 04/09 AM 11.0/11.5 3.2/ 3.7 4.0/ 4.5 3-4 MODERATE 04/10 PM 8.2/ 8.7 0.4/ 0.9 1.7/ 2.2 1-2 NONE 05/10 AM 8.5/ 9.0 0.7/ 1.1 1.5/ 2.0 1 NONE BRIDGEPORT HARBOR AT BRIDGEPORT CT MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
